div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

a.span: COVID Parent Letter Regarding End of Year Extension

div.p: April 17, 2020 Dear Parents and Community Members: I hope this message finds you and your families safe and well. Today, Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker announced that remote...
During the mandatory closure (currently through April 30th, 2020) of our regular school year, our school office hours will be Monday, and Wednesday through Friday from 9:00...

img.alt: Message from Dr. DeSchepper on Closure Extension

a.span: Message from Dr. DeSchepper on Closure Extension

div.p: Dear Parents and Community Members: I hope this message finds you and your families safe and well. Yesterday, March 31, Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker announced that remote...

The generous support of the Orangeville community over the years has enabled OEF to offer a first-time post-secondary $500.00 scholarship for the upcoming 2020-2021 school term. Any graduate from Orangeville High School who is currently enrolled in any post-secondary educational/training program may apply. The application is due by August 1, 2020. The application & scholarship information may be found on the school website under organizations & OEF, or click here https://5il.co/f4yp

Today's pictures are from Mrs. Helderman. While we've been closed, she's done a lot to keep busy, and also often goes on walks with her husband & son. Here she is with her dog, and with her son on one of those walks.

Today we highlight Ms. Nowak, school social worker. In addition to checking in with students & working remotely, she has been cooking and staying home. If your student is in need of help at this time, please contact the school & we can make sure Ms. Nowak gets in touch with you.

Sharing this on behalf of the PTO: Teacher Appreciation week is the week of May 4 – 8th. It would be great if students would take time in the next couple weeks to send their teachers hand-written notes or cards. This school closure is just as difficult for them as it is for the students & parents. Also, PTO would like to put together a video for the teachers in district from the students, and they need parental help. If you could snap a picture of your kid(s) holding a thank you sign of some sort, OR record a short video thanking their teacher(s), it would make our video super touching for the teachers. The pictures and videos can be emailed to the PTO's email address: OrangevillePTO@gmail.com. Deadline for the media submission is Friday May 1st.

Happy Friday! Today we highlight Mrs. Campbell. She likes to play fetch with Gretchen (see pic), and take her three dogs on long walks on the trail. She has also been reading, planning her summer garden and hoping that warmer weather returns soon!
